title: Lieutenant Novac-West Germany-Cold War
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2VVAlty

by Chiefraz

Cas is finally in West Germany and ready to take on his Army career, raise a family and come to grips with his alphas. Maybe life has finally begun. Welcome to Europe of the Cold War years. This part of the story takes place from January 1979 to August 1981

Words: 10998, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

Series: Part 3 of Cadet Novac

  • Fandoms: Supernatural
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, Rape/Non-Con, Underage
  • Categories: F/M, M/M

blog.title: Pet? He's my best friend!
blog.description: A Mark Sheppard and Crowley blog. A lover not a fighter. Currently doing Crowley and Benny in every episode. Posting my stuff on weekends. Sometimes I write. I'm here to talk if you need a friend.

summary: Well, then, let’s settle it. You and me. Right here. Winner takes the crown. See, that’s your problem, love. You think this is a...
caption: Well, then, let’s settle it. You and me. Right here. Winner takes the crown. See, that’s your problem, love. You think this is a fight. It’s not? It’s a campaign.

title: Wrong Number
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2Y1biYb

by TariTheNurse

Prompt: “You have found a ritual for summoning the Devil himself…but when you try it out it’s your neighbour that appears. Assuming the ritual has gone wrong, you let them go.” I couldn’t help but think of Crowley from Supernatural when I saw this prompt, so please accept the change to King of Hell rather than the Devil.

Words: 2019, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Supernatural
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: Gen
  • Characters: Crowley (Supernatural)

blog.name: riddleblack246
blog.title: You'll Find Me Dreaming
blog.description: Wild Writer. Ditzy Doodler. Wailing Wayward Daughter. Kick-Ass Kingsman. Tacky Trekkie. Belligerent Bookworm. Scorpio. Panromantic Asexual. INFJ. Melancholic. Neutral Good.I'm Delaney and I love drawing, reading, writing, sleeping and cute stuff.

tags: i'm on a roll today y'all
summary: things the characters of good omens collect outside of the obvious (i.e. crowley - plants, aziraphale - books of prophecy, etc.)...
body:
things the characters of good omens collect outside of the obvious (i.e. crowley - plants, aziraphale - books of prophecy, etc.)

crowley
-belt buckles. He likes them as a bold accent piece against his generally all black attire. He doesn’t wear them much anymore since he was informed that in combination with his snake-skin shoes, they were tacky. One he still wears on occasion is in the shape of a serpent winding around the leather; it was given to him by Aziraphale.
-sunglasses. He actually has a rack like the ones found at mall kiosks, so that he may select what he feels is most appropriate for the day.
-coffee table books. Usually photography ones or one filled with renaissance art. He doesn’t read them; they’re exclusively for the Aesthetic of his apartment. But the latter type is for when a certain angel stops by.

aziraphale
-embroidered… well, anything. He always found the art quite fascinating, but he never picked up the knack for it, so he settles for purchasing items he likes the work of. His favorite is a change purse he found in China in the 17th Century. Crowley prefers this fascination over his love of tartan.
-tea tins. He only collects those that he likes the packaging of and tends to reuse them, like putting new loose tea inside or spare change. In recent decades, he’s taken to putting little plants in them and giving them to Crowley.
-magician advertisements. They’re all original, as he collected them after witnessing a performance. He doesn’t have many from the present century, as he isn’t very fond of the outrageous theatrics, but there are a few. Most are rolled up and delicately placed away for when he would like to look at them again, but some are framed in the backroom of the shop.

anathema
-vintage perfume bottles. She doesn’t have many collections, given that she believed they were running on a rather short clock, but she did find that she liked using older perfume. She felt it connected her more to the past. And she could never bring herself to throw away the beautiful bottles said perfumes came in, so…
-crystals. She tends to kind of be a little judgy about what is or isn’t witchcraft and even says that crystals don’t necessarily have the amazing healing properties people claim they do. But she has several, simply because she likes how they look. She has since situated them in a sigil by the main window of Jasmine Cottage because they bounce light about the whole space and it makes her happy.
-”toys”. This is a recent collection, taken up since meeting Newt and beginning their relationship. They share this collection.

newt
-hard drives. Given his poor ability to work with technology, he picked up the hobby of taking apart and putting back together hard drives, just to see if he can fix ANYTHING. The answer is still no, but he finds that the devastation he causes lessens with each try.
-faux-leather jackets. He picks them up from thrift stores and flea markets. He thought they would give him a more cool and mysterious image. They really only manage to make him look like he’s chilly.
-”toys”. See above.

summary: Heaven is a Place on Earth
title: Heaven is a Place on Earth
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2XX78jU

by Trance

Dean is a mess. He can barely keep his crap together well enough to hunt, and Sam is definitely starting to suspect that something might be wrong. Cas is perfectly content to pretend everything’s fine, while avoiding him like the plague. Meanwhile, what should have been a simple witch hunt turns into a complete Fiasco. Sussex County, Dean decides, must be a special circle of hell just for hunters – or heaven for ghosts.

Words: 2821, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

Series: Part 2 of Another Day in Paradise

  • Fandoms: Supernatural
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Castiel (Supernatural), Dean Winchester, Sam Winchester, Gabriel (Supernatural), Bobby Singer, Original Characters, Crowley (Supernatural)
  • Relationships: Castiel/Dean Winchester, Gabriel/Sam Winchester
  • Additional Tags: Explicit Sexual Content, Angst with a Happy Ending, Angst and Fluff and Smut, Emotional Hurt/Comfort, Dean Winchester Has Trust Issues, POV Dean Winchester, Dean Winchester Has PTSD - Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder, Virgin Castiel, Slow Build Castiel/Dean Winchester, Getting Together, First Time, Castiel and Dean Winchester Being Idiots, Idiots in Love, Sam Winchester is Not Amused, Sam Winchester is So Done, Dean Winchester is Bad at Feelings, Case Fic, Castiel is Protective of Dean Winchester, Loss of Virginity, Friends to Lovers, Prankster Gabriel, Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence, Canon-Typical Violence, Sam Ships It, Urban Legends, New Jersey

summary: you know, crowley would buy a vape machine just for the hype, but he wouldn’t especially like it. you know who would like it?...
body:
you know, crowley would buy a vape machine just for the hype, but he wouldn’t especially like it.

you know who would like it? you know who really, really would like, the Old Pleasure of a cigarette without giving anyone issues with second-hand smoke, or people not liking the smell of the tobacco from his pipe, which he really misses? you know who would LOVE all the stupid flavours???

fastidious, dusty, chubby man-shaped creature in fucking, tweed, argyle, and wool, making polite conversation, and then he pulls out his VAPE

summary: Important question: While a sort of hierarchy of preference has been established with some Queen songs for Crowley and...
body:
Important question: While a sort of hierarchy of preference has been established with some Queen songs for Crowley and Aziraphale (liking “Fat Bottomed Girls” over “We Are the Champions” and “Another One Bites the Dust”, etc.), what do y’all think are their favorites?

I’m inclined to think Crowley’s is “Don’t Stop Me Now” and Aziraphale’s is either “The Millionaire Waltz” or “You’re My Best Friend”.

Neither will admit how much they love “Good Old-Fashioned Lover Boy”.

summary:
There’s a fanfic called City of Angels by 
PennyLane, it’s a crossover between Good Omens and tv show Angel (the vampire from...
body:
There’s a fanfic called City of Angels by PennyLane, it’s a crossover between Good Omens and tv show Angel (the vampire from Buffy) and I just wanted to say how incredibly fascinated I am with the way the author handled Aziraphale’s and Crowley’s connection in this story, it’s so beautiful that I wish this is something they would be actually able to do in canon.

In the story Aziraphale gets poisoned with blood magic and Crowley has to fight a hellbeast to help get the cure, but when he gets back after he actually KILLS it, the angel is already in coma, at this point Crowley is pretty badly injured himself but does something pretty amazing and I’m going to quote the scene below so if any of you don’t want to get spoiled, you don’t have to click on it.

Crowley took a deep breath, then closed his eyes and let his senses reach out. It scared him how long it took him to locate any evidence of the angel’s essence, but finally he found it. He swallowed, steeled himself, then he did something no demon ever willingly did: he reached out and ‘touched’ it; this was how you took an angel’s pulse. It should have been a blinding white jet stream of Good and holiness, powered by Aziraphale’s own unique personality, and the force of it should have slammed him into the wall of a house in the next block. But it was barely a trickle now, faint and unsteady, its light flickering uncertainly. And it hurt. Even as weak as it was, it gave Crowley a sudden blinding headache, and it took every ounce of his determination not to drop it as a human would drop a hot coal.

“Come on, angel, grab onto the life preserver,” he whispered, his voice ragged. “I know you’re tired, but you have to hang on a while longer. And damn it, if I can do it, you can do it.” And he clamped down hard on that pitiful stream of holiness that was Aziraphale’s pulse, and he held on tight.

His body and his own soul was in a state of unrelenting pain, and all his concentration was centered on holding onto Aziraphale, keeping his head above the metaphorical water, so he had no real sense of passing time.

-

Crowley was distantly aware of goings-on around him as the hours – or was it days? – passed. Pryce came in at regular intervals, doggedly taking Aziraphale’s human pulse and temperature and murmuring to himself as he checked the state of the sigils on the angel’s body; the girl kept bringing him fresh cups of tea, setting them on the night stand and taking away the untouched ones. But the only thing that really mattered to Crowley was that his headache was getting worse: Aziraphale’s essence was getting stronger.

He waited it out as long as he could, allowing the occasional whimper to escape, then steeled himself and gave a cautious mental 'nudge’ to test the limits of the angel’s growing strength. He grunted sharply as Aziraphale unconsciously pushed back. “Bastard,” he muttered ruefully, rubbing his forehead. He wasn’t going to be able to maintain his hold much longer because the growing potency of holiness was threatening to make him very sick indeed, and if he didn’t break off soon, nothing less than a visit Down Below would be able to restore him; and that was something he didn’t want to contemplate. But neither did he want to sever their tie until he was absolutely sure Aziraphale was going to be able to hold on by himself. Bracing himself, he gathered his power and sent out a challenging push that was the mental equivalent of a sharp elbow to the ribs. He had expected a response; however, he hadn’t expected to be blown out of his chair and ending up in a heap on the floor, grabbing his head and moaning, “Ow, ow, ow.”

There’s a fanfic called City of Angels by PennyLane, it’s a crossover between Good Omens and tv show Angel (the vampire from Buffy) and I just wanted to say how incredibly fascinated I am with the way the author handled Aziraphale’s and Crowley’s connection in this story, it’s so beautiful that I wish this is something they would be actually able to do in canon.

In the story Aziraphale gets poisoned with blood magic and Crowley has to fight a hellbeast to help get the cure, but when he gets back after he actually KILLS it, the angel is already in coma, at this point Crowley is pretty badly injured himself but does something pretty amazing and I’m going to quote the scene below so if any of you don’t want to get spoiled, you don’t have to click on it.

Crowley was distantly aware of goings-on around him as the hours – or was it days? – passed. Pryce came in at regular intervals, doggedly taking Aziraphale’s human pulse and temperature and murmuring to himself as he checked the state of the sigils on the angel’s body; the girl kept bringing him fresh cups of tea, setting them on the night stand and taking away the untouched ones. But the only thing that really mattered to Crowley was that his headache was getting worse: Aziraphale’s essence was getting stronger.

He waited it out as long as he could, allowing the occasional whimper to escape, then steeled himself and gave a cautious mental 'nudge’ to test the limits of the angel’s growing strength. He grunted sharply as Aziraphale unconsciously pushed back. “Bastard,” he muttered ruefully, rubbing his forehead. He wasn’t going to be able to maintain his hold much longer because the growing potency of holiness was threatening to make him very sick indeed, and if he didn’t break off soon, nothing less than a visit Down Below would be able to restore him; and that was something he didn’t want to contemplate. But neither did he want to sever their tie until he was absolutely sure Aziraphale was going to be able to hold on by himself. Bracing himself, he gathered his power and sent out a challenging push that was the mental equivalent of a sharp elbow to the ribs. He had expected a response; however, he hadn’t expected to be blown out of his chair and ending up in a heap on the floor, grabbing his head and moaning, “Ow, ow, ow.”
trail.content:
There’s a fanfic called City of Angels by PennyLane, it’s a crossover between Good Omens and tv show Angel (the vampire from Buffy) and I just wanted to say how incredibly fascinated I am with the way the author handled Aziraphale’s and Crowley’s connection in this story, it’s so beautiful that I wish this is something they would be actually able to do in canon.

In the story Aziraphale gets poisoned with blood magic and Crowley has to fight a hellbeast to help get the cure, but when he gets back after he actually KILLS it, the angel is already in coma, at this point Crowley is pretty badly injured himself but does something pretty amazing and I’m going to quote the scene below so if any of you don’t want to get spoiled, you don’t have to click on it.

Crowley took a deep breath, then closed his eyes and let his senses reach out. It scared him how long it took him to locate any evidence of the angel’s essence, but finally he found it. He swallowed, steeled himself, then he did something no demon ever willingly did: he reached out and ‘touched’ it; this was how you took an angel’s pulse. It should have been a blinding white jet stream of Good and holiness, powered by Aziraphale’s own unique personality, and the force of it should have slammed him into the wall of a house in the next block. But it was barely a trickle now, faint and unsteady, its light flickering uncertainly. And it hurt. Even as weak as it was, it gave Crowley a sudden blinding headache, and it took every ounce of his determination not to drop it as a human would drop a hot coal.

“Come on, angel, grab onto the life preserver,” he whispered, his voice ragged. “I know you’re tired, but you have to hang on a while longer. And damn it, if I can do it, you can do it.” And he clamped down hard on that pitiful stream of holiness that was Aziraphale’s pulse, and he held on tight.

His body and his own soul was in a state of unrelenting pain, and all his concentration was centered on holding onto Aziraphale, keeping his head above the metaphorical water, so he had no real sense of passing time.

-

Crowley was distantly aware of goings-on around him as the hours – or was it days? – passed. Pryce came in at regular intervals, doggedly taking Aziraphale’s human pulse and temperature and murmuring to himself as he checked the state of the sigils on the angel’s body; the girl kept bringing him fresh cups of tea, setting them on the night stand and taking away the untouched ones. But the only thing that really mattered to Crowley was that his headache was getting worse: Aziraphale’s essence was getting stronger.

He waited it out as long as he could, allowing the occasional whimper to escape, then steeled himself and gave a cautious mental 'nudge’ to test the limits of the angel’s growing strength. He grunted sharply as Aziraphale unconsciously pushed back. “Bastard,” he muttered ruefully, rubbing his forehead. He wasn’t going to be able to maintain his hold much longer because the growing potency of holiness was threatening to make him very sick indeed, and if he didn’t break off soon, nothing less than a visit Down Below would be able to restore him; and that was something he didn’t want to contemplate. But neither did he want to sever their tie until he was absolutely sure Aziraphale was going to be able to hold on by himself. Bracing himself, he gathered his power and sent out a challenging push that was the mental equivalent of a sharp elbow to the ribs. He had expected a response; however, he hadn’t expected to be blown out of his chair and ending up in a heap on the floor, grabbing his head and moaning, “Ow, ow, ow.”
trail.content_abstract:
There’s a fanfic called City of Angels by PennyLane, it’s a crossover between Good Omens and tv show Angel (the vampire from Buffy) and I just wanted to say how incredibly fascinated I am with the way the author handled Aziraphale’s and Crowley’s connection in this story, it’s so beautiful that I wish this is something they would be actually able to do in canon.

In the story Aziraphale gets poisoned with blood magic and Crowley has to fight a hellbeast to help get the cure, but when he gets back after he actually KILLS it, the angel is already in coma, at this point Crowley is pretty badly injured himself but does something pretty amazing and I’m going to quote the scene below so if any of you don’t want to get spoiled, you don’t have to click on it.

blog.title: That Hieronymus Bosch. What a weirdo.
blog.description: A Good Omens side-blog. | Mostly running on the queue. | Ask to tag | I tag for #lemon, so you may block it | About Discord server invites for mobile | I'm usually known as Socks, they/them, 20-something, just here for the laughs | Posts are okay to add to and I like hearing other people's headcanons and opinions, they're fun
